result.execSummary:
The defendant Antonio Donte McDade was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Antonio Donte McDade is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Antonio Donte McDade was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury, Use of a Dangerous Weapon, Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant advised to have no contact with firearms.

Pay DNA surcharge, all costs, assessments and victim witness surcharges.
To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of prison funds under SEc. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.

records.addlTxt: Signed, Filed, and Distributed; Order Concerning Sentence Adjustment denied.
Per order of the Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to Hon. Janet C. Protasiewicz, Br. 24, for review. mag
Reflects 12-09-15 Court order for 136 days of sentence credit

Order Amending Judgment of Conviction, signed and filed on 12-09-15.

THEREFORE, IT IS HEREBY ORDERED that the judgment of conviction shall be amended to reflect a TOTAL of 136 days of sentence credit.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Jeffrey A. Wagner, Br. 38, for review. mag
DOC request to review order for sentence credit.

Defendant Antonio Donte McDade in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Defendant Antonio Donte McDade in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  CASE HEARD FOR BRANCH 40.
Matter was set for speedy trial today in branch 40.  Case spun to Branch 38.  Parties have resolved case.  
AS TO COUNT 4 AS CHARGED:    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The court made a finding that the defendant is a repeat offender.
AS to counts 1, 2, and 3:  Court orders counts DISMISSED.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by state, defense and defendant.
State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law.  Victim is present but does not wish to address the court.
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 2 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, credit for 146 days time served.  CONFINEMENT of 1 YEAR  and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 1 YEAR with the following conditions:
-The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
-Pay all costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges.
-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
Defendant is to undergo Anger Managment counseling.
Obtain GED.
The defendant is advised to have no contact with firearms.
Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program of Substance Abuse Program.
Defendant is remanded.
Filed: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Pretrial Credit
from the state received and filed.  rmm

received and filed.  rmm

COUNT 1:  POSSESSION OF A FIREARM BY A FELON, REPEATER , contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 941.29(2), 939.62(1)(b), a Class G Felony.
.
COUNT 2:  STRANGULATION AND SUFFOCATION, REPEATER, USE OF A DANGEROUS WEAPON, DOMESTIC ABUSE, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 940.235(1), 939.50(3)(h), 939.62(1)(b), 968.075(1)(a) a Class H Felony.
.
COUNT 3:  FIRST DEGREE RECKLESSLY ENDANGERING SAFETY, DOMESTIC ABUSE, USE OF A DANGEROUS WEAPON, REPEATER , contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 941.30(1), 939.50(3)(f), 968.075(1)(2) 939.62(1)(b), a Class F Felony.
.
COUNT 4:  MISDEMEANOR BATTERY, DOMESTIC ABUSE, USE OF A DANGEROUS WEAPON, REPEATER , contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 940.19(1), 939.51(3)(a), 968.075(1)(a), 939.62(1)(b), a Class G Felony.

Defendant Antonio Donte McDade in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Defendant Antonio Donte McDade in custody.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Final Pretrial held.  Case remains set for jury trial on 9/28/15 in Branch 40.  State put the offer on the record and withdrew the offer to the defendant.  State will be filing an Amended Information.  Court reminds defendant the no contact order remains in effect.

Attorney James Edgar Toran in court, defendant Antonio Donte McDade not in court, in custody.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  ENTRY MADE WITHOUT THE FILE. Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court. Case remains calendared for a final pre-trial on 9/2/15 and jury trial 9/28/15.

Attorney James Edgar Toran in court, defendant Antonio Donte McDade not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for bail hearing.  Court is in trial and cannot hear the matter.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for 08-18-2015 at 08:30 a.m.  Final pre-trial scheduled for 09-02-2015 at 8:30 a.m.  Jury trial scheduled for 09-28-2015 at 8:30 a.m.

Defense counsel enters a Speedy trial demand.

Defense counsel requests bail hearing; due to court calendar congestion bail arguments cannot be heard on today's date.  Court orders case also adjourned for bail hearing.

Court advises defendant that all conditions of bai remain as previously set including the No Contact Order.

Defendant Antonio Donte McDade in court with Attorney James Toran.  Defendant Antonio Donte McDade in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie, appearing for Kristin Schrank, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court approves stipulation of counsel; Atty. Toran is now counsel of record.
State files with the court certified copies as to Case# 04CF001366

Defense counsel requests brief adjournment of the trial.
Court orders trial vacated and case adjourned for final pre-trial and jury trial in Branch 40.
Clerk:  jms
Atty. Jason Canfield appeared in court prior to the case being called on the record and signed the stipulation.  Consent And Order Of Substitution Of Attorney received and filed.

Attorney Jason Canfield in court, defendant Antonio Donte McDade not in court, in custody.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  Case remains set for final pretrial on 8/06/15.
Defendant's Motion for Modification of Bail received and filed.  ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE.   rmm

Attorney Jason Canfield in court, defendant Antonio Donte McDade not in court, in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie for Michael Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Scheduling Conference held.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for September 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Antonio Donte McDade in court with attorney Jason Canfield.  Defendant Antonio Donte McDade in custody.  Nathaniel Adamson for Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: CHEQUETTALIN M.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Antonio Donte McDade in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Defendant Antonio Donte McDade in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40. 
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Not Guilty Plea as to Count 3 and Count 4 entered by the Court on behalf of the defendant.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.

Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant. 
Court advised Defendant he  may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wis. Stats. Section 165.77(4).

Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
